metadata.title: CASE 425/04: REPORT OF INVESTIGATION
metadata.primary_source: Office of Internal Oversight Services, Investigations Division

overview: The investigation focuses on alleged mismanagement by the UNMIL Fuel Cell Officer, examining unaccounted fuel expenses and potential unauthorized sale of fuel by staff.

applicable_laws.excerpt: Staff members shall uphold the highest standards of ... integrity. The concept of integrity includes ... impartiality, fairness, honesty ... in all matters affecting their work and status.
Staff members shall use the property and assets of the Organization only for official purposes and shall exercise reasonable care when utilizing such property and assets.

methodology.description: ID/OIOS conducted interviews with concerned parties excluding Officer 1 and reviewed all relevant documentation.

background.context: UNMIL was established by the Security Council to support peacekeeping in Liberia. The Officer in question was previously with MONUC and helped establish the Fuel Cell at UNMIL.

investigation_details.subject: Officer of the UNMIL Fuel Cell

allegations.description: Mismanagement and waste of resources, specifically inability to account for US$500,000 in fuel expenses.
allegations.findings: An audit discovered 290,066 gallons of fuel valued at US$455,404 were unaccounted for; however, no evidence was found linking Officer 1 personally to the discrepancy.

allegations.description: Allegations against bowser drivers and supervisor for selling fuel to third parties.
allegations.findings: UNMIL’s Special Investigation Unit found credible evidence against bowser drivers and their supervisor, leading to their dismissal.

findings: The complainant was unable to provide evidence implicating Officer 1 in the US$500,000 discrepancy.
Officer 1’s involvement in the Fuel Cell issues could not be substantiated.

actions: UNMIL accepted 16 out of 17 recommendations from IAD/OIOS regarding fuel management improvements.
DPKO should record this case as unsubstantiated and inform Officer 1 that he is cleared of any wrongdoing (ID Rec. No. IV04/425/01).
